results.description:
Our last Tipsy Painting Party sold out so we're doing it again! Start your new year's resolution of trying something new a little early!

Why just paint when you can Tipsy Paint? That's what we thought too! So put a brush in one hand and a drink in the other, and join us for a unique, colorful way to spend the night out and make new friends!

Tipsy Painting is a step-by-step, group-oriented painting instruction, which is designed to simultaneously entertain and enlighten our members. A professional artist guides you through a featured painting that is yours to keep and proudly display at the end of the night. And don’t worry — no experience is necessary. 

PREPAY ONLY (MUST PURCHASE IN ADVANCE) $35-$40 -

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Dec-30-2015_at_0630PM

*Price goes up to $40 as the event date gets closer. We recommend getting tickets ASAP to save $ and guarantee your spot. This event will sell out, especially for women. Tickets will not be sold at the door.  

What's included: 

• 2 1/2 hour course lead by an expert artist to teach you the art of mixing colors, blending and painting techniques. 

• 12x16 pre-sketched canvas, acrylic paint (water based), and all painting supplies (brushes, aprons, easels) supplied

• Drink & Food Specials (1 drink min, can be non-alcoholic)  

 • Great Music At Right Volume For Mingling 

• Free Raffle & Prizes 

Get Tickets At This Link (no door sales) -  

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Dec-30-2015_at_0630PM

Can I still attend even If I don't know how to paint? Yes, no experience is necessary. 

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

Why does your RSVP say +25?  This is a multi-Meetup and we have a good # of groups co-organizing this event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  

Is this age/ethnic/age specific? No, this event is not meant to be age/ethnic specific or gender balanced. All are welcome, 21+.

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/painting/dates/Dec-30-2015_at_0630PM

results.description:
If your holiday spirit (and courageous liver) can handle another night of merry mayhem, join us for our annual Holiday Drinks. 

We'll have a round or two of drinks sponsored by touchlab, our first 2016 meetup announcement, and as usual, great convos with good people in the NYC Android and GDG-NY community.  


Names will be checked for entrance and drink tickets. 


Happy holidays!
results.name: NY Android Devs Holiday Drinks 2015 with GDG-NY

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Dining

DESCRIPTION:         

Zest is run by a team of enthusiastic and experienced restaurant staffs. We specialized in both Japanese and Thai Cuisines. Whether you have a special occasion to celebrate or just in the mood for some Asian food. Zest will be able to accommodate your needs.

http://zest249.com/

• Live Uni

• Rainbow Layer (Tuna, Salmon, White Tuna, Mango, Avocado)

• Pineapple Fried Rice

• Grilled Salmon with Teriyaki Sauce

• Tofu Teriyaki

results.name: The Manor - Dôme Nightclub, Semi-Formal Winter Dance Party with Rumba Lesson

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book Spiritual Laws That Govern Humanity and the Universe by Lonnie C. Edwards, M.D.

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 13: The Plan.

You can download the e-book FREE here!

About the Book

God has created laws by which the universe is governed. Humanity has continued to set these laws into creative motion through thoughts, prayers, motives, intentions, voices, and beliefs. These are the right tools. In this book the student will learn how to use them always for the good.

Human beings are responsible for creating the good, the beautiful, and the true-all of which we desire to experience. But humans are also responsible for creating that which we do not desire to experience. However, being co-creators with God, the quality of our thoughts, beliefs, and intentions will determine and manifest our world. There is work to do, and those who are on the path with knowledge of God’s attributes and God’s laws, and with love and good will in their hearts, will do that work. This is your guide to put these concepts into practice in our troubled world today!

All are Welcome!
results.name: The Plan

results.description:
We did this last year and it was a magical dream! Ancestors were called, libations were poured, good food was consumed, and gifts were exchanged!

So it's time again to bring out those amazing outfits and yummy vegan recipes!

Some of you all don't know what Kwanzaa is. 

Some of you all know what it is and don't celebrate.

This holiday season we will celebrate uniquely and lovingly!


So I decided to have our Holiday Party at my apartment. We will dress up, eat, drink, and exchange gifts! A good 'ol fashioned house party Kwanzaa style!


We will be playing the black version of white elephant!

1. Bring a gift under $5 that's wrapped (for kwanzaa gifts are usually handmade but you can buy one ;). )

2. Bring a Vegan dish to eat and share with ancestors

3. BE ON TIME! We cannot start the game if folks are late. If you are going to be excessively late please lave the slot open to others :D

Meet me at the crib, it's goin' DOWNNNNN. 

Can't wait to see ya'll there!
results.how_to_find_us: Ring Buzzer 2 :D
results.name: 2nd Annual  Vegan Kwanzaa Celebration Gift Exchange and Potluck!

results.description:
Join us for Scrabble every Wednesday.  The first people usually arrive between 5:00 and 5:30, and the last people leave around 10:00.  Come any time.

We tend to play two-person games.  It's a friendly, low-key game with a range of skill levels.  Whatever people agree on in terms of dictionaries, challenges, and anything else is fine.  The main objective is to have fun.

Panera in Wayne is on Route 23 southbound, in the Brentwood Plaza (second driveway south of Ratzer Road).
results.name: Scrabble

results.description: http://www.meetup.com/betanyc/ please RSVP here AND on their link shown above. give your first and last name. Beta NYC, is a great place to ask... where should i download city data from? Ignore the note on this page, which says, "Max: 1 person". We never max out room capacity. The reason it says it's maxed out, is because I can't sign you up. A photo ID is mandatory. Sometimes, the map on this meetup link above, is incorrect, so please write down the address. bring your best id, for security guards and be patient... the guards can't allow you inside, until the host says, they are ready.
results.name: data for civics Wednesday, beginners welcome

results.description:
Learning English? Want to make your pronunciation better? 
Join for a small group lesson with an English teacher! 

Class Part 1: 7pm-8pm 
-Small group lesson, max 10 people 
-Reading the newspaper 
-Pronunciation practice 
-Group discussion 

Class Part 2: 8pm-9pm 
Open conversation practice with other students & Native English speakers 

If you cannot stay for part 2, you will be able to attend any one of our language conversation practice events for free next week.

It is $10 to attend the class. This includes entrance for the conversation practice event with native speakers right after. Bring a notebook, questions & a pen!
results.name: English CLASS! Reading practice, Pronunciation, and English idioms!

results.description:
Join us Wednesday as we have a social party with tasty Korean food and fun language games. Come and improve on ways to practice your language learning with others for our Pre-New Years Eve soical. The meetup cost is $5.00

Please feel free to bring food and especially drinks (soda, juice, wine, soju or beer), with you.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

New York City's hottest open mic in the heart of Queens' cultural mecca and in the homiest underground spot around - one level downstairs in the Q4 Hotel in Long Island City.

Produced by the long-running independent performance series, The Inspired Word (http://inspiredwordnyc.com), which has featured Grammy winners, American Idol finalists, Golden Globe Award winners, Emmy nominated actors, and HBO Def Poetry stars, this open mic is open to ALL types of performing artists - musicians, comedians, poets, fiction/nonfiction writers, playwrights, spoken word artists, storytellers, performance artists, dancers, etc.

20 performance slots, 6-minute time limit for anything spoken, 7 minutes for anything musical. **Note to musicians: If you have backing tracks, bring them on an mp3 player or smartphone. Note to piano/keyboard players: You must bring your own keyboard.**

We are dedicated to celebrating the best of Queens' performing arts and developing a warm local artistic community. 

NO AGE RESTRICTIONS.

*****

When: Every Wednesday Night

Where: Q4 Hotel
http://www.q4hotel.com/

29-09 Queens Plaza N.
Long Island City, NYC

Time: 7pm sharp

Admission: $7 online for solo performer or audience member, $10 at the door

This is a very popular open mic. You can pay online or at the door, but we STRONGLY suggest you purchase a ticket in advance to guarantee a performance slot.

*****

By subway, take the E to Queens Plaza, N/Q/7 to Queensboro Plaza.

*****

Produced by Mike Geffner Presents The Inspired Word

"It's not just a series...It's a movement."

#SupportLiveArtsNYC

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!

You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $9. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. What is West Coast Swing? 
If you've ever wanted to learn how to dance to your favorite songs, this "Club Swing" style is perfect for you!!! Club Swing, AKA West Coast Swing, is a really fun, contemporary version of East Coast Swing and Lindy Hop. results.description:
The Games Women Play- A Dynamic and Interactive Lecture.

We live in a culture where men often feel lost without a rule book. “I wish there was a manual or a way to know if I’m doing it right!” you might think. Do you ever feel confused or misunderstood in your relationships with women? Well there is a manual, but it’s not what you might think. The way to learn how to be connected with women is simply to use your attention, and more simplicity than you think, to draw out her desire. There is no formula, it’s all about feeling. At OneTaste, we teach you how to cultivate your attention, increase the simplicity in your connections, and draw out desire.

Join us for an amazing evening where we get to learn the secrets behind the games women play. Two senior OM practitioners, will talk about their relationship and how the benefits of the Orgasmic Meditation practice help men to more deeply understand, play with, and become successful in the arena of being connected to powerful women.

Through this practice men learn the skill of handling and being in connection with women. They learn how to be successful in relationship to her and lovingly navigate the challenging spots in their connection. Aubrey and Dave are two advanced practitioners on the New York OM community staff, and they will take you through the ways that women play games to fuel men and how to use the games as a means to have deeper intimacy, a hotter sex life, and more consciousness in their relating.

***When you register or attend please make a point to mention to us you found this event through NYC Pleasure without Borders MeetUp.

The event is $10 at the door. Doors Lock at 8:10.

Contact Marissa Ward for details at [masked]

Can't make this one? visit www.turnonny.us

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 8-10pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 14 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Be part of the team!  You CAN make a difference in the world. 

Our strategy is simple, the outcome is huge. 
Empower individuals so that they experience significant growth of their own political and personal power, as well as discover and celebrate their own capacity to make a significant difference in this world. Our volunteers break down partisan and ideological barriers by reaching out to key stakeholders to build positive, effective working relationships.

Learn how you can generate the political will for a stable climate. 
View this short video: https://youtu.be/9oyguP4nLv0

What Others Are Saying

"With all the negative news on climate and Congress it's understandable to feel discouraged.  But hopelessness is not a strategy for making a difference and neither is acting alone.  Citizens' Climate Lobby is the antidote, the missing link, the Harvard of citizen activism." ---

Sam Daley-Harris Founder, RESULTS, Microcredit Summit Campaign, and the Center for Citizen Empowerment and Transformation

"Most impressive is the work of Citizens' Climate Lobby...If you want to join the fight to save the planet, to save creation for your grandchildren, there is no more effective step you could take than becoming an active member of this group." ---

Dr. James Hansen Climate scientist and former head of the NASA Goddard Institute

"The Citizens' Climate Lobby has identified the issue of pricing carbon as a vitally important lever in promoting dialog and action on climate protection. If you've been looking for that one group to join, you can stop looking now." ---

Dr. Daniel Kammen Professor - University of California, Berkeley

To learn more about Citizens' Climate Lobby visit us online at:

www.citizensclimatelobby.org

and also register for a Wednesday night (8 PM ET)

one hour introductory conference call.

VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: Don't let a very-low RSVP sign up number on the Meet-Up site discourage you from attending. The call is advertised in other places nation-wide. People who are already members attend local meetings and may not RSVP to the meetings listed on meetup.

results.description:
Special event. The popular Mystery diners tv show is airing Action Burger's episode "Comic capers" on December 30th at 10pm. Viewing of the episode will be done at the restaurant with the owner. Restaurant has their own published sci-fi novels and comic books.


FREE Signed or not signed BIO-Sapien comic for RSVP members that show up (signed copy required food purchase). 

Characters from the owner's sci-fi book are on this mystery diners episode, so the owner will also be selling his newly published "BIO-Sapien" here for half price (Also available for sale on Amazon and Barnes & Noble).  


Hang out with the owner, play free video games, board games/card games and have fun at this national televison show event. 


During event/meetup:

1. 5 shots for $5.
3. Rum and coke 32oz $10.
4. Two milkshakes for the price of 1.
5. Buy a beer, get two free shots.

6. 1/2 price autographic BIO-Sapien novels & Free bio-sapien comic book give away.  Normal novel price is $10, this night it will be $5. 

______________________________________________________________

BIO-Sapien crosses the following movies: Star Wars, Matrix & X-men. 

With Star wars bring so popular now, one professional book reviewer suggested BIO-Sapien is heading in that direction:

"Science fiction fans unite! If the title doesn't say it all, I don't know what will! To preface this review, all of you naysayers out there who shake their heads at sci-fi should remember that, back in the 70's, the names R2-D2, C3PO, Chewie...you get my point, here...were unknowns. Now they are as much a facet of popular literary culture as is Mr. Darcy. Jane Austen, Henry James, Dickens, etc., were beautiful storytellers, but sci-fi has amazingly imaginative beauty surrounding it as well. And this author, Vlane Carter, knows that for a fact.... 

 ...there are A LOT of scenes that the reader gets to experience. From the military battle with the UFO, to the alien shark attack on another planet (which is really cool, by the way), this author offers a never-ending parade of amazing creatures and locations that will, perhaps, one day be logged into popular literary culture right beside old C3PO and his little beeping buddy...

...There are two factions out there in America - Star Wars vs. Star Trek - and I am definitely on the side of George Lucas having the more creative concept. So hats off to this writer, Vlane Carter, who may someday join those Lucas ranks if readers and sci-fi fans everywhere band together and realize that the force really MAY be with this one." – FEATHERED QUILL REVIEWS.

Prologue: 

A young man by the name of Jaden is abducted by benevolent aliens, bio-engineered to superhuman levels and sent back to Earth years later to stop an alien invasion.

150,000 years ago Darclonians began on an experimental dark energy/dark matter weapon that works only with carbon based life forms. The organic subject would eventually die.

100,000 years ago Darclonian probes sought out thousands of planets with life on them that could develop into intelligent life forms. The probes fired Quadrillions of Nanomoles into Earth’s atmosphere seeking intelligent life.

The Nanomoles hid inside of the modern Homosapien brain and studied humans for thousands of years. The Nanomoles recorded our feelings, memories, emotions, experiences and DNA from generation to generation.

Today the Nanomoles await a signal from a Darclonian mothership to begin it’s 84 hour three stage countdown.

Jaden’s Nanotechnology bio-engineered body is the key to perfecting the Darclonian’s weapon of mass destruction (Dark Energy Knight). Jaden becomes a super hero unlike anything created before.

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

results.description:
The difference between cheap processed fast foods and gourmet, organic whole foods is the difference between the sex we’re taught to have and the sex that’s possible. We believe not only that more is possible— we believe more is a must. We believe that a life full of hot, connected, deeply nourishing and spectacular sex is very much worth living.

The crazy thing we’ve found about sex is that with every other high-performance activity, people know you can’t get better by just doing it. You get better by breaking down the skills involved and practicing them. People don’t become world-class musicians just by playing music— they practice scales. People don’t become professional football players just by playing football— they train. 

But not with sex. People seem to think they can improve their sex lives just by… having sex. (And maybe reading a few Cosmo or Men’s Health articles.)

This isn't how anyone achieves mastery in anything.

Over years of research, we developed a simple, potent practice to bring consciousness to the realm of sexuality and provide a training ground for sex and relationship. We call it OM: Orgasmic Meditation. 

Come talk to Orgasmic Meditation instructors and relationship coaches from OneTaste and have your questions about sex, relationship, connection, orgasm, and OM answered. 

**OneTaste is an international organization devoted to bringing consciousness to the realm of human connection.**

A coach will be at a table in the back room of Maman wearing a shirt saying "Orgasm."
Text Dave at[masked] with any questions.
results.name: Hacking the Female Orgasm
$10 New Year's Eve early pick up

results.description:
You don't often think it matters because the Libertarian Party is not a recognized Minor Party in New York State but our new State Chair is committed to increasing the number of registered Libertarian Party members and to seeing that all leaders in the LPNY and its County Organizations are registered Libertarian.

While there is disagreement about the efficacy of such a plan, I see no reason why we should help the new State Chair in any way possible.

Use this link to download the Change of Party Voter Registration Form and on the line to the right of "Other", write "Libertarian Party.

http://vote.nyc.ny.us/downloads/pdf/forms/boe/voterreg/voterregenglish.pdf

Then mail it in to your local County Board of Elections.

If you have any questions, ask.

In Liberty,

Dr. Tom Stevens 
LPQC Chair
results.name: Libertarian Party Registration Drive

*Midnight kiss?

results.description:
This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

 

==> Learning & Practice RESOURCES

Various materials http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/thread/3199165/0#[masked]

KANJI http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1175397
KATAKANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198386
HIRAGANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198387

Please click over DISCUSSIONS ->Message Board, then select your favorite topic. Have a lot of FUN learning about Nihon & Nihongo! http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me, with the pile of Japanese dictionaries at one of the tables in the Atrium, or one of the other groups speaking in and about Japanese.
results.name: Weekly Japanese Study Group

results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Cosmic Attunement

results.description:
Spend New Year’s Eve at the dharma center!  The evening will start with a public talk, followed by a party with non-alcoholic beverages and food, and finally a New Year’s Eve puja (chanted meditation).

SATISFACTION:  Can’t Get No!

7:30 – 9:00 p.m

Public talk and guided meditation

with Peter Kurczynski

We all wish for happiness, but over-indulging our cravings for food and other pleasures fails to deliver lasting satisfaction, and holds us in a state of pain and isolation.  Buddha’s teachings help us to unravel the psychology of craving and dis-satisfaction.  Meditation gives us a taste of the freedom and fulfillment that is possible when we let go of compulsive thoughts, feelings and actions.  Discover peace within.

Party!  

Party with food and non-alcoholic drinks. Bring something to share is you wish!

9 – 11:15 pm

Tara Prayers for World Peace

11:15 pm – midnight

Tara is a female Buddha, a manifestation of the ultimate wisdom of all the Buddhas.  Her name means ‘Rescuer,’ and by reciting her praises, we receive protection and inconceivable benefits.  In these difficult times, we request Tara to bless us and all people in the world.

$20 admission (no one will be turned away for lack of funds)
results.how_to_find_us: Meditatenj.org

50+ Meetup groups are once again throwing the LARGEST NYE Meetup Singles Party!  300+ will be attending like last year's party, and this will sell out again, so don't wait to get tickets!

Ticket prices will go up as the event gets closer. Definitely take advantage of the early-bird price we're offering now - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/2016/

$49 til 12/13, $65 til 12/26 (will most likely be sold out by 26th)

$85-$100, 12/27-12/31 (goes up as NYE gets closer, if avail)

What to expect:

• Open Bar 7-8pm (doors open at 6:30PM)

• Complimentary Appetizers (8-9PM) 

• Light Continental Breakfast served (1AM)

• Ice Breakers, Prizes & Giveaways

• DJ & Dancing  

• Champagne toast at 

• Professional Event Photography

• Midnight kiss?

All of our past NYE parties have SOLD OUT so if you'd like to attend, you must PREPAY ASAP (Tickets will NOT be sold at the door) - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/2016/

FAQs: 

Is this event private? Yes. The entire venue will be 100% private for our members and their guests. This is not ethnic/age specific (21+). All are welcome. 

Can I come alone? Yes. Most come on their own. You can come alone or bring friends - either way you'll have a great time. 

Why does your RSVP say +99? 50+ groups are co-organizing so the RSVP's shown here are only a small portion of the members attending.  300+ will be in attendance as in past years.

What do I wear? Dress to impress. No sneakers, hats. Jeans ok. 

PLEASE NOTE: Tickets WON'T be sold at door and RSVPing without payment will NOT reserve your spot. To guarantee admission, in addition to RSVPing, you MUST purchase your tickets here - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/2016/

Join over 400 Singles at our 9th Annual New Years Eve Singles Party! With music and dancing, fun ice breakers, complimentary appetizers, a cash bar, and fun prizes, our party will be the best party in town! You won't want to miss it!

What to expect: 

• Over 400 Singles ages 20s, 30s, & early 40s.

• Drink specials

• Fun Ice Breakers

• World-renowned DJ Easy Calderon

• Complimentary open bar from 7pm-8pm

• Complimentary appetizers

• Complimentary champagne toast at midnight

• Complimentary party favors for everyone

• A Midnight Kiss?

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Price:

• Only $65 til Dec 30th


• $85 on Dec 31st

• $100 at door without RSVP if space allows.

OUR NEW YEARS EVE PARTY LAST YEAR WAS SOLD OUT  WITH OVER 500 PEOPLE ON OUR WAITING LIST. DON'T LET IT HAPPEN TO YOU! RSVP NOW TO RESERVE YOUR SPOT BEFORE OUR PARTY IS SOLD OUT.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

What are the recommended ages?

Women 21-45, Men 23-45

Is this event private? 

The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 200+ members attending.

Note, this is not an Indian-only event, but we have a large Indian following, so you can expect to see lots of Indian singles in attendance.

results.name: Welcome the New Year with Music and Mingling at the Healing Zone

results.description:
The Sound Mind gathering explores the vibrational and sound healing for personal meditation, soul expansion, as well as physical well-being. 

When we learn to use our breath and voice for toning, chanting, and psychosomatic actualization, we become powerful healers. The gifts we were born to share come to fruition if we but dare to explore, expand, AND express our vibrational state. You can tune your Soul-Body to higher dimensions and progress your visionary abilities following the scale of sound and color - starting where you are and who you are at the present moment and then climbing up.

The starting point is like looking at a hiking map with a little red circle that says 'you are here' and all the possible trails ahead and then you take off - transcendence path is a process that is anchored in the body. No matter how natural and sacred, there is no vine, shroom, or chemical that will take you to the next level of spiritual consciousness. You can change your state and catch a glimpse of your transcendent vision, yes, right here within your Soul-Body.

Sound Mind is about a durable and steady progress into who you were meant to become in this amazing moment of opportunity that we call a human life. It goes fast, so why not …make a sound?
results.name: Sound Mind - Heal Your Life with Sounding, Toning, and Chanting

results.description:
Mark Cohen has trained trained Zhan Zhuang since 1967.
Taoist method, Yiquan and Wu and Yang Tai Chi.

Here is a list of my lineages so you will know I am a serious and honorable person.

Yiquan Lineage: Wang Xiang Zhai - Han Xing Yuan - Fong Ha - Mark Cohen.

Old Yang lineage: Yang Jian Hou - Tian Zhaolin - Xu Xiao Fong - Yu Xiao Lin - Mark Cohen

Yang Cheng Fu lineage:
Yang Shou Chung - Ha Cheung Fong - Mark Cohen
Dong Ying Jie - Fong Ha - Mark Cohen

Wu Lineage: Wu Jian Quan - Liu Hung Jie - Fan Qing Ren - Mark Cohen

I also have a 7th generation lineage in Chinese Medicine. (Ku Family)

I'm writing to let you know about a new book I've written entitled, Inside Zhan Zhuang.

In addition to breaking down Standing Meditation's actual transformation process for the first time, the book is an in-depth look at Zhan Zhuang's relationship to health and healing, internal martial arts and Tai Chi, and expanding perception/consciousness.

Below I have included a YouTube link to a video trailer summary of what's in the book and the Facebook and Amazon pages.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pPQKxsEQ6ko https://www.facebook.com/InsideZhanZhuang
http://www.amazon.com/Inside-Zhan-Zhuang-Mark-Cohen/dp/0988317885/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1362074491&sr=1-1&keywords=Inside+Zhan+Zhuang
results.name: Book release for Mark Cohen's book entitled "Inside Zhan Zhuang"

venue.address_1: 317 East Houston, between Avenues B & C.
venue.name: The Parkside Lounge

results.description:
NYC's hottest open mic brings in the new year!

This year, instead of not knowing what you're doing on New Year's Eve, or having to dole out a ton of cash AND travel, why not spend it doing and supporting what you love as well as something totally, uniquely hot? A night of nothing but awesome LIVE PERFORMANCE. An open mic of music, poetry, comedy, and spoken word! 

With ongoing performance slots until the ball drops, you can: 1. Sing into the new year. 2. Poet into the new year 3. Laugh us into the new year! 4) Speak into the new year.

Whether this is your destination for the night or you just stop by to say hi, know that you have the choice to put meaning to the last hours of 2015! Make it count and do something that makes you, well, you! Tell someone you love them! Wish someone good fortune! Write what you are grateful for! Anything that makes you the loving and supportive person you are the last hours of 2015!

Here are the details:

35 performance slots, 7-minute time limit for anything spoken, 8 minutes for anything musical. 

**21+ AGE LIMIT. MAKE SURE TO BRING VALID ID**

Full backline. Honky-tonk piano (feel free to bring your own keyboard). Cool stage. Comfy cabaret-style seating. 

*****

When: Thursday night, Dec. 31, 2015

Where: The Parkside Lounge

317 East Houston Street, Manhattan

Directions: By Subway: Take the F to Second Avenue. Go up the 1st Avenue stairs and head East on Houston Street.

Time: Doors open at 6:30, open mic starts at 7pm, ends at midnight when the ball drops

Only way to guarantee a performance slot is to register via http://newyearseveopenmicnyc.eventbrite.com

Admission: $15 @ the door, but various discounted options online, as low as $8. 

***TWO DRINK MINIMUM***

Cheap drinks, including the Bailout Package (shot of whisky + 22-ounce beer) for only 8$, and $2 non-alcoholic options available.

For performers, we STRONGLY suggest buying an advance ticket to secure a performance slot. This is all but guaranteed to be a SELLOUT. 

No refunds or transfers. 


*****

Produced by the long-running Inspired Word open mic series, which has featured Grammy winners, American Idol finalists, Golden Globe Award winners, Obie Award winners, Emmy nominated actors, and HBO stars, The Inspired Word open mic is open to ALL types of performing artists - comedians, musicians, storytellers, singers, poets, fiction/nonfiction writers, playwrights, spoken word artists, performance artists, dancers.

Mike Geffner Presents The Inspired Word
http://inspiredwordnyc.com/

"It's not just a series...It's a movement."

results.description:
Join over 400 Singles at our 9th Annual New Years Eve Singles Party! With music and dancing, fun ice breakers, complimentary appetizers, a cash bar, and fun prizes, our party will be the best party in town! You won't want to miss it!

What to expect: 

• Over 400 Singles ages 20s, 30s, & early 40s.

• Drink specials

• Fun Ice Breakers

• World-renowned DJ Easy Calderon

• Complimentary open bar from 7pm-8pm

• Complimentary appetizers

• Complimentary champagne toast at midnight

• Complimentary party favors for everyone

• A Midnight Kiss?

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Price:

• Only $65 til Dec 30th


• $85 on Dec 31st

• $100 at door without RSVP if space allows.

OUR NEW YEARS EVE PARTY LAST YEAR WAS SOLD OUT  WITH OVER 500 PEOPLE ON OUR WAITING LIST. DON'T LET IT HAPPEN TO YOU! RSVP NOW TO RESERVE YOUR SPOT BEFORE OUR PARTY IS SOLD OUT.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

What are the recommended ages?

Women 21-45, Men 23-45

Is this event private? 

The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc  Jeans ok. Dress stylish.

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We will have 200+ members attending.

results.description:
Meet for Italian food at the Brio Tuscan Grille in the Willowbrook Mall. Meet in the lounge at 7:15PM (I''ll be there @7PM) then be seated at 7:30PM. Please give 24 hours cancellation notice
Payment: Separate checks, please include at least 18% tip.
Meeting: I'll have a Meetup sign or ask for Monica's table.
Menu: The regular menu is available and there's also a prix fixed menu, you can order from either one. See www.brioitalian.com


"BRIO invites you to gather with friends, family and co-workers to experience the flavors of Tuscany without leaving the country. Bringing the pleasures of the Tuscan country villa to Wayne, our chef-inspired Tuscan recipes are sure to tempt your palate. At BRIO we believe that "to eat well is to live well." Buon Appetito!"
results.name: Brio Tuscan Grille - Goodbye 2015 dinner

results.description:
Hello Everyone: 

It's time to announce our New Year's Eve Bash, a multi-group event!

2016 is right around the corner, come celebrate with us!

Open Bar (Beer, Wine & Well Drinks) 7:30-8:30 PM

Complimentary Appetizers 7:30-8:30 PM 

Date: Tuesday, December 31st

Time:  7:30 PM till... 

Dress: Elegant

Dancing: YES!

$30 Early Bird Special Until Dec. 14th

$40  Dec. 14th- Dec. 29th

$50 Dec. 29th-31st

$60 @ the door if available.

PLEASE NOTE:  This is a multi-group event so space is limited. Your RSVP does not guarantee you a spot unless you pre-pay! 

Location: Vermilion

480  Lexington Ave. (at 46th Street) 

Vermilion.com

I'll post more info as I have it so stay tuned!

Happy New Year!

Andy

results.description:
Its New Years Eve and its time to ring in 2016 with some laughter! 

FREE LIVE COMEDY SHOW at the Village Lantern, right in the heart of historic Greenwich Village!!


Come with a friend, or come solo.

All comics performing on the show are professionals and have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Late Night TV (Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc) + MORE!!


Being just around the corner from the legendary Comedy Cellar, we regularly get special guest drop in's from some of the biggest names in comedy!!

The Village Lantern is located at 167 Bleeker St.

Trains Stations Nearby: W. 4th St- D/B/M/F/A/C/E, Bleeker St- 6, Christopher St- 1

Meetup and hang out in the bar area from 730-8 and join us downstairs in the Comedy Club at 8 for the FREE SHOW!!

The Lantern offers a full bar and food menu, including $5 Comedy Show specials including:

Drink:

$5 Can of Beer
$5 Well Drink
$5 Glass of Wine

+ Full Food Menu

** 1 item minimum for the show **

results.description:
Come on out for the last DWA of the year.  Our founder has been kind enough to offer his place for what we hope will be the best godless gathering of the year.  Bring yourself, bring your friends, bring things to share.  

There will be prizes.  Lots of prizes.  Awesome prizes.  

No event on Friday the 1st, we all will need a day of rest after all.  


Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.name: Gotham Atheists New Years Eve Bash

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE

We’re holding the biggest New Years Eve bash yet at the Hudson Station Bar & Grill! This is a big one not only because it is on NYE but also 3 floors of party space, with an open bar and passed appetizers from 8-9 pm.

Unlike any other party you’ve been to, This party will also give you the opportunity to WATCH & LISTEN to the Live Broadcast of the Carson Daly countdown on the Red channel.

Your 3 Channels will be:
Green DJ: Top 40
Red DJ: 8PM – 12:01 AM: Carson Daily Show Countdown
Red DJ: 12:01 AM – 3 AM: EDM Dance Music!
Blue DJ: Hip Hop, Caribbean

What makes the night special?:
– A pair of Quiet Events Headphones
– Watch & Listen to Carson Daly Countdown
-2 Live DJs till 12 and then 3 after 12am
– Glow-in-the-Dark Gear & Party Favors
– 3 Floors to party
– OPEN BAR from 8-9pm
– FREE appetizers from 8-9pm

Special Notes:
Age Restriction: 21+
Rain or Shine
Tickets are limited, if Sold out tickets will NOT be sold at the door!

VIP party package:
Private VIP Top Floor: $80/Ticket
– Private bathroom
– Private bar
– private coat check
– Open views of DJs & crowd below
– Seating for 20
– Personal Security Guard to block non-VIP

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process***
When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJs with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.

Thursday, December 31st 2015 


OPEN BAR 9pm-12am 

Join us as we ring in the New Year at our premium celebration in the company of NYC's most fabulous women. Hosted by Nikki Hill of SPICE NYC! 


DJ Nikki Lions& DJ Rosy Q will be heating up the dance floor all night long! 

Don't miss out on our general admission tickets offering open bar, assorted platters for snacking, and a complimentary champagne toast at midnight. 

Enjoy watching the live news feed of the ball drop broadcasted on our HD flat screen TV's! 

To take it a step further, we're offering VIP packages & Couples tickets with preferred table seating & bottle service, including open bar, & premium champagne bottles and/or premium vodka bottles. 

There's only one way to properly ring in your New Years, and that's with SPICE NYC AND ADKLN. Sexy, chic & glamorous.

Purchase Your Advanced Tickets Below:

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/spice-nyc-new-years-eve-2015-a-black-tie-affair-tickets-18371114498


New Year's Eve Tips 


We are located 2-3 blocks away from the famous Times Square Ball Drop. 


*Print out tickets to show to New York Police Department to get behind Time Square baracades. Last year Cops were helpful and friendly and let us breeze through. 


*If you leave early you avoid the crowd AND find parking! Last year I was able to park uptown and walk to venue. I arrived at 8pm. *Friendly reminder to drink responsibly. 

We do not condone drinking & driving. Please have a designated driver or use public transportation.
results.name: New Year's Eve 2015- A Black Tie Affair

group.name: A Different Kind of Ladies' Night - NYC

results.description:
Please read carefully:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network Group and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up here reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating.  If you have any questions regarding this event contact the event host at [masked].

We have put together the perfect party for those who want to ring in the new year away from hundreds of overcrowded and noisy bashes around town. The atmosphere at our event will be like going to a friends apartment party where everyone is connected in some way.  We'll have fun and get a little crazy with all the elements you're looking for without the super loud music, crammed bars and creepy strangers.  If you are looking for great people and an awesome value read on...... 

The World Bar is not a night club or tavern, it is an upscale lounge with 2 levels of comfortable seating with couches, 25 foot floor to ceiling windows, awesome cocktails and will be tastefully decorated to get you in a festive mood!

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

To register you will need to go directly to <a>www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.</a> Prepayment only

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

What to expect:

-150 members and friends of The New York Social Network. (only 150 tickets sold in a room that holds much more)

-NYSN owner Dave Cervini & staff waiting at the front door ready to welcome you and introduce you to others at the party.

-Delicious hot and cold appetizers served till 11pm. (crab cake, Mushroom truffle risotto, sirloin skewers, spring rolls, smoked salmon, bruschetta, cheese and crackers)

-NYE drink specials at a cash bar. (So no pressure to drink till you drop at an open bar).

-A great selection of music played by DJ B.B. at conversation levels early on so you can actually talk to others.  We'll carefully turn up the volume and the energy as the night progresses for those who want to dance.

-Live coverage from Times Square on several monitors.

-Champagne toast at midnight

-hats, noisemakers and party favors.

Who will be attending? a great mix of members and friends, singles and maybe some couples mostly ages 20's -40's.  There will also be some 50's. If age is a hang up for you then don't register here. You will definately find plenty of people your age to socialize with.  We will also monitor the male to female ratio to encourage a nice mix so everyone has a dance partner!

Can I come alone? Yes 95% of those attending will likely be coming on their own but will all be connected by Dave and The New York Social Network in some way.

Dress Code: Dressy, cocktail attire.  If you want an excuse to dust off your tux do it!  Most of all be comfortable.

</a><a href="http://www.newyorksocialnetwork.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/world-bar-3.jpg">The World Bar

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

To register you will need to go directly to <a>www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.</a> Prepayment only

$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$

results.description:
Please read carefulyl:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network Group and their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on your Meet Up here reflect only a portion of those actually attending from all the groups participating.  If you have any questions regarding this event contact the event host at [masked].

We have put together the perfect party for those who want to ring in the new year away from hundreds of overcrowded and noisy bashes around town. The atmosphere at our event will be like going to a friends apartment party where everyone is connected in some way.  We'll have fun and get a little crazy with all the elements you're looking for without the super loud music, crammed bars and creepy strangers.  If you are looking for great people and an awesome value read on...... 

The World Bar is not a night club or tavern, it is an upscale lounge with 2 levels of comfortable seating with couches, 25 foot floor to ceiling windows, awesome cocktails and will be tastefully decorated to get you in a festive mood!

What to expect:

-150 members and friends of The New York Social Network. (only 150 tickets sold in a room that holds much more)

-NYSN owner Dave Cervini & staff waiting at the front door ready to welcome you and introduce you to others at the party.

-Delicious hot and cold appetizers served till 11pm. (crab cake, Mushroom truffle risotto, sirloin skewers, spring rolls, smoked salmon, bruschetta, cheese and crackers)

-NYE drink specials at a cash bar. (So no pressure to drink till you drop at an open bar).

-A great selection of music played by DJ B.B. at conversation levels early on so you can actually talk to others.  We'll carefully turn up the volume and the energy as the night progresses for those who want to dance.

-Live coverage from Times Square on several monitors.

-Champagne toast at midnight

-hats, noisemakers and party favors.

Who will be attending? a great mix of members and friends, singles and maybe some couples mostly ages 20's -40's.  There will also be some 50's. If age is a hang up for you then don't register here. You will definately find plenty of people your age to socialize with.  We will also monitor the male to female ratio to encourage a nice mix so everyone has a dance partner!

Can I come alone? Yes 95% of those attending will likely be coming on their own but will all be connected by Dave and The New York Social Network in some way.

Dress Code: Dressy, cocktail attire.  If you want an excuse to dust off your tux do it!  Most of all be comfortable.

Our party philosophy:  There are a dozen social networking and Meet Up groups that promise "The BIGGEST NYE Party".  We don't need the biggest we just want the best for those looking for a great night out based on our description!  If you are looking for something big and wild and boozy, we may not be the best choice, but we can guarantee you that you will have fun!  When choosing your New Years destination make sure to read the info carefully especially about the hours of open their bars, food provided, the number of people they expect, etc.  Others will offer open bar packages for people who want to drink till they drop.  At our event you can pay only for how much or little that you drink. With an 8:pm start time you will have plenty of time to eat beforehand (although we will have a group dinner nearby, details to come).  We also will not increase the price as we get closer to try and scare you into registering. You  pay $25 if you sign up November 2nd or December 29th. If tickets are available on December 30th and 31st they will be priced at $35 because we will have to incur last minute additional food/staffing costs. THE FEE IS NON REFUNDABLE AFTER DECEMBER 1ST.

Take a look around.  There are hundreds of options for New Years Eve.  I am sure that if you know our group and our commitment to providing quality experiences, you will find that we will be providing a great experience at a fantastic price!

How do I get there?  The World Bar is located on the corner of 1st avenue and east 48th.  The 51st and 42nd street subways stop closest and there are cross town buses.  Cabs are always plentiful.

Can I pay at the door?  Probably not as we will likely sell out. 

How long will it last? We will likely be there until 2 or 3am.

If you have any questions about this party contact NYSN founder and party host Dave Cervini at[masked] or email [masked].

</a> <a href="http://www.newyorksocialnetwork.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/world-bar-1.jpg">

</a><a href="http://www.newyorksocialnetwork.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/world-bar-3.jpg">The World Bar
results.name: NYC's Friendliest, Casual & Comfortable New Years Eve Party: SOLD OUT

results.description:
Its New Years Eve and its time to ring in 2016 with some laughter!

Come celebrate with us at this FREE LIVE COMEDY SHOW at the Village Lantern, right in the heart of historic Greenwich Village!!

Come with a friend, or come solo.

All comics performing on the show are professionals and have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Late Night TV (Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc) + MORE!!

Being just around the corner from the legendary Comedy Cellar, we regularly get special guest drop in's from some of the biggest names in comedy!!

The Village Lantern is located at 167 Bleeker St.

Trains Stations Nearby: W. 4th St- D/B/M/F/A/C/E, Bleeker St- 6, Christopher St- 1

Meetup and hang out in the bar area from 730-8 and join us downstairs in the Comedy Club at 8 for the FREE SHOW!!

The Lantern offers a full bar and food menu, including $5 Comedy Show specials including:

Drink:

$5 Can of Beer
$5 Well Drink
$5 Glass of Wine

+ Full Food Menu

** 1 item minimum for the show **

results.description:
This Just In Athena Reich Goes GAGA at our GLAM BALL | NEW YEAR REVOLUTION!!! Come out you "Little Monsters"
for the Biggest Star Studded NYE Celebration in NYC!!! 


Pulling out all the stops this year NYE at The All New Henrietta Hudson with your fave host Rose Garcia of the Real L Word! Beats by the one and only DJ Mary Mac fresh off Madonna's Rebel Heart Tour and our world class resident spin master DJ Sandra Liliana Corrales

ATTIRE: ALL THAT GLITTERS!!!

Tickets Here!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/glam-ball-new-year-revolution-tickets-19845512462

Haute Cuisine by chef Karen Morgan feat. shrimp cocktail, deconstructed sushi, fig baskets, mixed variety sliders, cheese and olive platters, creme brulee, chocolate mousse. Food is served 8-11pm. Scrumptious menu for all Guests!

Be safe & cozy in the Gayborhood of the West Village &
avoid the drama of Times Square on NYE!

Come early for our $20 reduced cover before midnight, $25 after.
VIP @ $50 includes 3 hour open bar 9pm-midnight.

Champagne toast at midnight! Hats and noise makers!
Lots and lots of confetti! And our 5am breakfast
feat. the famous Brooklyn Rainbow Bagels!
results.name: Henrietta Hudson Glam Ball New Year Revolution!!

results.description:
Are You Ready For It!


The Year 2016 Is almost upon us, how will you be celebrating New Years Eve this time around? If you haven't made plans yet, why not join us at Ruby Lounge In Totowa NJ. Let's party and make it a Really Great New Years Celebration!

Doors Open At 8pm.


$20 Admission Til 9pm. Must Mention "Meetup" At The Door.

$25 Admission After 9pm.

Expecting A Full House, Arrive Early Or Event May Be Sold Out.


Admission Includes:

* Light Buffet 9pm To 10:30pm (While Supplies Last)

* 2 DJs Playing The Best Of Classics, Top 40, And Latin Music

* Free Parking In There Huge Lot

* Meeting Section For Group Members

* Live Broadcast Of The Ball Drop & New Years Countdown On Multiple Big Screen TVs

* Champagne Toast At Midnight (While Supplies Last)

* Noisemakers & Bead Necklaces (While They Last)

Multiple Meetup Groups Will Be In Attendance.

Ruby Lounge Is Off Route 46 West, Make A Right @ The Petco Sign. Then Go Right Again And Park To The Left Parking Lot. Then Walk Across To Ruby Lounge Entrance.

This New Year's Eve S.O.B.’s invites you to A Night in Tropical Paradise with Salsa legend Eddie Palmieri and the sexy Tropicana dancers. Dine in ecstasy with the best Latin-fused island menu in NYC. Dance your way into 2016 to the Grammy winning Salsa tunes of Fania All-Star Eddie Palmieri. SOB's offers two (2) party package options perfectly crafted for ringing the New Year. The Platinum package includes a 5-course seated dinner and a table reservation for the evening. The Gold package is non-seated and includes passed hors d’oeuvres. Both packages inclusive of a midnight classic champagne toast and traditional party favors. For advance purchase, dinner reservations and bottle service please contact [masked] or (212) 243-4940.

JOIN MULTIPLE MEETUP GROUPS AS WE CELEBRATE NEW YEARS EVE AT RUBY LOUNGE IN TOTOWA NJ!

The Year 2016 Is almost upon us and If you haven't made plans yet, why not join us to party and make it a really great celebration!


Doors Open At 8pm. And The Party Goes Til Late! 

$20 Admission Til 9pm. Must Mention "Meetup" At The Door.

$25 Admission After 9pm.

Expecting A Full House, Arrive Early Or Event May Be Sold Out.


Admission Includes:

* Light Buffet Starting At 9pm (While Supplies Last)

* 2 DJs Playing The Best Of Classics, Top 40, And Some Latin Music

* Free Parking In There Huge Lot

* Meeting Section For Group Members

* Noisemakers & Bead Necklaces

* Live Ball Drop & New Years Countdown On Multiple Big Screen TVs

 * Champagne Toast At Midnight (While Supplies Last)

Multiple Meetup Groups Will Be In Attendance.

Ruby Lounge Is Off Route 46 West, Make A Right @ The Petco Sign. Then Go Right Again And Park To The Left Parking Lot. Then Walk Across To Ruby Lounge Entrance.

PROMO VIDEO: ENJOY!

https://youtu.be/iNkZc1zcXIk

results.description:
SPICE NYC hosts New Year’s Eve 2015

A Black Tie Affair @ Croton R.T.

Thursday, December 31st 2015

http://www.spicenyc.eventbrite.com 

Join us as we ring in the New Year at our premium celebration in the company of NYC’s most fabulous women.

Hosted by Nikki Hill of SPICE NYC!

Resident DJ Nikki Lions & Guest DJ Rosy Q will be heating up the dance floor all night long!

Don’t miss out on our general admission tickets offering OPEN BAR , assorted platters for snacking, and a complimentary champagne toast at midnight. Enjoy watching the live news feed of the ball drop broadcasted on our HD flat screen TV’s! To take it a step further, we’re offering VIP packages & Couples tickets with preferred table seating & bottle service, including open bar, & premium champagne bottles and/or premium vodka bottles.

There’s only one way to properly ring in your New Years, and that’s with SPICE NYC. Sexy, chic & glamorous.

Purchase Your Advanced Tickets Below:

      http://www.spicenyc.eventbrite.com

Friendly reminder to drink responsibly. We do not condone drinking & driving. Please have a designated driver or use public transportation.

Get your tickets here: http://www.spicenyc.eventbrite.com/

results.description:
We are proud to present our 2016 New Year’s Eve Gala Celebration. We did our very best to create an event that will deliver an experience designed to forge lasting memories for You, your Family, Friends and all cherished Guests.

Your celebration will include a full service, UNLIMITED open premium bar. The evening continues with a hand crafted, delicious gourmet DINNER buffet, complete with table service. The highlights will include a live band performance by the acclaimed CharanSalsa Orquestra and live DJ music by the DJ Alliance of Geo Salsa, Harry T. (of Salsa Warriors) and “Mr. ATACA!” J. Antonio (of Men of Salsa). Our NYE celebration will be broadcast LIVE on Salsawarriors.com

Let's not forget the Champagne and party favors when the clock strikes twelve!

The backdrop for this much anticipated event is the elegant Crystal Ballroom inside the boutique and luxurious Royal Regency Hotel. Free on-site parking is available for all guests. Every ticket purchase includes FREE admission to our Sophisticated Latin Saturday party at Venue Lounge, adjacent to the Crystal Ballroom, in the Royal Regency Hotel. This specialized party takes place on the 1st Saturday of every month, where our guests are encouraged to dress their very best for an elegant affair (on the remaining Saturdays of each month, we continue on with our normal party). So when you’re ready to continue on with your celebration, Saturday night at Venue will be the place to be as we kick-off the new year right!

As an added incentive, there will be discounted rates for rooms at the Royal Regency Hotel (subject to availabilty). Please inquire on Hotels.com, and input Royal Regency Hotel, Yonkers NY.

Our main goal was to combine great entertainment, location, and overall experience for each and every guest. We believe strongly that we were able to achieve this by making this celebration available for only $125.00 (includes tax and gratuities) per person . Better still is that this early reservation price is locked in until Friday December 18th, giving everyone ample time to participate! We look forward to having you with us!

FOR TICKETS - http://djalliance.ticketleap.com/new-years-eve-gala/

*Please note that formal attire is required for this event. Thank you

results.name: New Year's Eve at Antun's

results.description:
Let's get together to ring in the new year and welcome 2016!!

Join us for an evening of fun, food, and drinks! I will be making the notorious matzah madness (ingredients = matzah, chocolate, a variety of nuts, homemade caramel, other stuff, and love)! You won't want to miss it! Also provided will be hors d'oeuvres, finger foods, and beverages.

We are asking each guest to bring EITHER:
1. The beverage of their choice (Vodka, select beer, and a variety of wines will be available)
-OR-
2. A small side/munchy for the group. Salads are always a good choice--lettuce, bean, pasta.

If we're unable to attend, we wish you a healthy, prosperous, and happy new year! See you in 2016!!

RSVP soon!! Space is limited!!

results.description:
New Years Eve Mingle at Pub 1910 a Top The Glen Cove Mansion for

 Founded in 1994 by Melissa Doktofsky,

Toys of Hope, New York's favorite charity supports over 65,000 needy children, their families and their pets every year. Toys of Hope operates all year round and does not have any paid employees or professional fund raisers. 100% of all donations goes towards helping families in need. Known for "More Than Toys", the charity has created many programs that provide desperately needed goods and services to assist families in becoming self-suffient and, in turn, helping to improve their children's lives. . Help for Families and their Pets.... 

http://www.toysofhope.org/aboutus.html  <<,  Toys of Hope

So often when the family suffers the dear pets are neglected too.

Just bring  a New and unwrapped toy(s) and or pet food supplies (s) family essentials, food item (s) .. and Join us...  see below.....

Its a casual night ......dress comfortable .....

Relax at the sofas , game tables , billiards   plus

Delicious Menu items from appetizers to a Prime Steak to order

Hats, Noisemakers Toast at Midnight....

No Cover .....  Your Donation of a warm generous heart with your dropped off parcel is our entry ..... Just bring  a New and unwrapped toy(s) and or pet food supplies (s) family essentials, food item (s) .

Multiple groups attending..

Live Music through the night with the Nina Gordon Party and her 5 piece band


Nina Gordon has been entertaining since childhood throughout Long Island and the tri-state area, as a solo performer accompanying herself on guitar, and with her country band Savannah Sky.  More recently, she has built up a following with her retro-rock band Rear View Mirror and performing as a duo called The Nina Gordon Party. Tonight the Party is expanding to a FULL BAND, featuring some of the area's top musicians, including Skip Krevens on guitar & vocals and Ed Canova on bass & vocals. Nina is passionate about the music she performs, and that passion is reflected in her performance. The Nina Gordon Party will be rockin' in the New Year with danceable tunes from a variety of genres, from jazz standards to country, pop & rock classics.  Join us and enjoy the party!

Its a casual night ......dress comfortable .....

Relax at the sofas , game tables , billiards   plus

Delicious Menu items from appetizers to a Prime Steak to order

Hats, Noisemakers Toast at Midnight....

No Cover .....  Your Donation of a warm generous heart with your dropped off parcel is our entry .....

Multiple groups attending..

..

No Cover .....  Your Donation of a warm generous heart with your dropped off parcel is our entry .....

results.description:
Buy Tickets Now!! 

http://privegroupticket.com/nye2015

http://privegroupticket.com/nye2015

At 10:00 pm on December 31st 2016 Privé is gathering the finest of New York’s high society for a night of exuberance and dancing at New York’s highest loft oasis, the Midtown Loft and Terrace. 


We cordially invite you for a special NYE party hosted by Playboy's very own Ashley Massaro featured on the cover of Playboy Magazine. 

Playboy's Ashley Massaro, socialites, and celebrities will dance while bringing the New Year together. Come drink and eat all night at NYC's most exclusive party including an All Night Open Bar from 9pm-4am and enjoy delicious passed appetizers. 

The Ambiance- an 11 story rooftop loft penthouse, is Manhattan’s best kept secret. Featuring full circumspect panoramic views, of the empire state building and across the NYC Skyline. The private loft event space is two stories with one penthouse loft space below an exquisite rooftop. This is NYC's only all night Open Bar, come bring in the New Year, on top of the best city in the world. 

This, invite-only event will have socialites and celebrities in attendance. Top executives, models, celebrities anchored by Privé guest list will be dressed in their most fashionable attire to dance the evening away, bringing the New Year in on the top of the world. 

The surprise celebrity guests are confirmed but remain anonymous. Past celeb attendees include The Pussycat Dolls, Kid Cudi, Swiss Beatz, Derek Jeter, Richie Rich, Pamela Anderson’s muse and designer partner, Hall of Frame basketball player Earl The Pearl Monroe, and much more.
results.name: 2016 All night Open Bar! NYE

results.description:
做好迎接新年的准备了吗？还在犹豫跨年夜在纽约干什么吗？还在纠结如何和朋友们一起让新年伊始变的更有意义吗？法拉盛网除夕倒数嘉年华诚邀你的参加!

在2015即将画上尾声，让我们在动人的歌声中，舞动起来，一起庆祝一个充满爱与回馈的夜晚。法拉盛网带来的将不仅仅只是一个普通的跨年夜，它将让你的2015结束的更加难忘，2016开始的更别有一番新意！

法拉盛网为你找到全纽约最大最宽敞的舞池，Sheraton hotel ballroom. 更有DJ Pao 现场打碟，让你感受一个全纽约最火热而激情的夜晚！

更特别的是，派对上将有实况转播纽约时代广场璀璨四射的跨年倒数表演。届时，你将在温暖的室内，和所有在场的时尚达人们一起，倒数，跨年，看零点那一刻巨大彩球的掉落!

party 以 中西合璧的 方式举行！9:00pm 开始check in. 每隔半小时表演！另半小时跳舞，自由交友的轻松方式进行！全力打造一个纽约华人 社区最有感觉, 最有活力，最多 fun 的一个party! 门票包两杯鸡尾酒！小点，DJ , 灯光，大抽奖，除夕倒数，party favor. 跳舞，时装秀，设立不同风格的拍摄区，并观看 法拉盛网好声音 和辣妈竞芳华的演出！

地点在喜来登酒店[masked] ave flushing ballroom .时间：12/31/2015 晚上九时至凌晨一时，门票75 ，请到新世界商场102 室或者[masked] ave 幸福起点购买吧，电话[masked]
results.name: 法拉盛网除夕倒数嘉年华

results.description:
In an annual St. Bart’s tradition, William Trafka, Director of Music and Organist, performs a free organ concert to ring in the New Year. He will play Debussy’s Première Arabesque and Elgar’s Imperial March along with works by Bach and Widor on St. Bartholomew’s grand Aeolian-Skinner pipe organ, one of New York’s greatest musical treasures. Trafka’s own transcription of Copland’s Fanfare for the Common Man will be played at the stroke of midnight.
A free champagne reception will follow the concert.
results.name: New Year's Eve Concert

venue.name: New York Society for Ethical Culture

results.description:
http://nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/new-year.jpg?itok=5VPnwZ_h Got any plans for... New Year's Eve?

Our Thursday, December 31 party to celebrate the end of 2015 and the beginning of 2016 is both a don’t-miss special event from 9 pm to 12:30 am and an amazing bargain to boot!

Purchase Tickets Here

It includes:

• Live music – a terrific three-piece band 
• Dancing – ballroom, swing, and do your own thing 
• Entertainment – dancers, songs, raffle 
• Fun with: silly hats, party horns, confetti 
• Table seating – for your comfort and camaraderie 
• Wine, cheese, nibbles 
• Light buffet dinner 
• Midnight countdown 
• Bubbly for midnight toast 
• Fireworks over Central Park viewed from our rooftop at midnight

Your ticket includes an entry for our door-prize – dinner for two at one of our fine local restaurants.

And by the way, it actually pays to bring a nonmember friend, so invite one to join the party! 
Ticket prices: individual member $69;two members $128 member with non-member guest $138 non-member $84; non-member couple $158

This event is not only for fun, but we also hope to raise funds for the Televised Visiting Project of our Social Service Board – the program that allows children to see, hear, play and talk with their imprisoned parents via television.

If you are unable to come to the party, please consider making a contribution to the event for our new fund to help defray the 
expenses of this wonderful project. 
And happy new year to one and all!

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.
results.how_to_find_us: Social Hall
results.name: New Year's Eve Party
