results.description:
[5th slam of '15-'16 slam season]

5:30 PM -- Writing workshop run by our very own Nick Yuknalis. Come and write with us! 

6:30 PM -- Doors/signups for the slam are OPEN.

7:02 PM -- POETRY BEGINS. 5-person open mic, followed by three round, 8 poet slam. [Slam is performance poetry competition judged by audience; if you want to compete, have at least three poems of at least three minutes in duration because it is a 3-round slam. all work should be your own work. no props, costumes, animal acts, fire, backing tracks, etc.]

Come for the poems,stay for the love. Or vice versa.

$5 at the door.

Ten dollar prize for the winner of the slam.

RULES FOR THE OPEN MIC: you get 5 minutes to do whatever.


RULES FOR THE SLAM: you get 3 minutes to do 1 original piece, sans costumes, musical accompaniment, props, animals, etc. Anyone can sign up to perform; first 4 slam spots are first-come, first served; last 4 spots will be determined randomly from anyone else that wants to compete. Judges will be chosen from the audience. Top scoring poets advance to the second round and the third round. Different pieces needed for each round so bring three poems!

Any poem you slam with this month cannot be used the next time you slam with us.

Parking is free from 6 PM to 11 PM in the public lots.
results.name: Jan Poetry Slam @ Casa del Sol in Nyack

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.
results.how_to_find_us: The meeting is at 26 2nd Avenue, between 1st St. and 2nd St. You can take the F train and get off at the 2nd Ave. stop (and use the 2nd Ave. exit at that station).
results.name: Bhagavad-gita Class & Kirtan @ 5:30 p.m. on Saturdays at 26 2nd Avenue, NY, NY

group.name: Kirtan Yoga & Bhagavad Gita As It Is Discourses -- NYC

results.description:
Back by popular demand! There are 4 seats available for this meetup. Reservation is under Eric Weisberg. Please note neither Eric nor I will attend this event. Happy New Year! :-D

The Place: Mario Batali and Joe Bastianich's flagship restaurant, located on Waverly Place in Greenwich Village, opened to great acclaim in 1998 and is as bustling and popular as ever. It offers dining that redefines and reinvents the principles of Italian cuisine for 21st century America. An epic, landmark wine list, an exciting, quintessentially New York dining room and expert, attentive and cordial service make a table at Babbo one of New York’s prized possessions.


Menu: http://www.babbonyc.com/menu/dinner/

RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Babbo - Italian - One Michelin Star

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 34-47 - 1f/3m spots left

group.name: And That's Why You're Single Events - NYC

results.description:
Join us for a Cuddle Party - an experiential workshop and social event.  Where else can you attend a workshop in your pajamas, or yoga clothes.

To attend you must purchase a ticket in advance. See details below.


Cuddle Party is … a workshop!

Though touch is natural, the skills that make it welcome and enjoyable have to be learned. Skills of communication, boundaries, asking for what you want, and saying ‘Yes’ or ‘No’ with clarity and kindness.

Cuddle Party is led by trained and certified Cuddle Party Facilitators. The Facilitator’s job is to guide you into those skills gently and easily, in a fun, safe and light hearted way. We welcome you and create an atmosphere of respect, and remain available for questions and support.

At a Cuddle Party you gain:
* Clarity and confidence
* Boundary and communication skills
* Comfort, support and encouragement
* The secrets to welcome, relaxed, non-sexual touch

The skills you learn at Cuddle Party translate into every day life, right from the start. When boundaries and consent are clear, every relationship is easier.

Where else can you attend a workshop in your pajamas?

Cuddle Party is … a social event!


We open with a Welcome Circle - about 45 minutes of introductions, rules and a few games to help everyone get comfortable. We teach communication and boundary skills in ways that are lighthearted and fun.

Then we open up for ‘free-style’ cuddling. You have plenty of time to relax, chat, share a back rub or other welcome touch, cuddle, have a snack or just hang out.

You can come to a Cuddle Party to meet new people, to enjoy amazing conversations, to touch, to be touched, to have fun, to practice asking for what you want, to practice saying “no” to what you don’t want — all in a setting structured to be a safe place for exploration and enjoyment. Shucks, you can even come to a Cuddle Party just to cuddle!

These are the Cuddle Party rules.

1) Pajamas (or cuddle-clothes) stay on the whole time.

2) You don't have to cuddle anyone at a Cuddle Party, ever.

3) You must ask permission and receive a verbal YES before you touch anyone. (Be as specific in your request as you can.)

4) If you're a yes, say YES. If you're a no, say NO.

5) If you're a maybe, say NO.

6) You are encouraged to change your mind anytime you want.

7) Respect your relationship agreements and communicate with your partner.

8) Get me of my assistant if you have a questions or concern or need assistance with anything during the Cuddle Party.

9) Tears and laughter are both welcome.

10) Respect people's privacy when sharing about Cuddle Parties and do not gossip.

11) Arrive on time.

12) Be hygienically savvy.

Want to know more about Cuddle Party?

Cuddle Party has been around since February 2004.


There is lots of information about Cuddle Parties on the official Cuddle Party website www.cuddleparty.com so if you are curious, be sure to check out the FAQ section and some of the articles too

Be On Time: PLEASE arrive on time at 6:00 PM to check-in and change into your Cuddle Clothes so we can start the Welcome Circle by 6:30 PM.

No Late Arrivals: Sorry - but after the Welcome Circle begins, no late arrivals can enter

What To Wear: Pajamas/Athletic Wear.  Think more comfy than sexy. 

What To Bring: A pillow or stuffed animal if you like. Otherwise, just bring your smiling self.

Your Cuddle Host will provide light snacks and beverages.

Looking forward to Cuddling with you soon,

Registration Details


Cost: $25

Purchase Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cuddle-party-at-big-buddha-yoga-studio-start-2016-with-a-cuddle-tickets-19899749687?aff=es2


When you register or attend please make a point to mention to us you found this event through NYC Pleasure without Borders MeetUp.

You must get a ticket in advance. This is the only way to ensure space will be reserved for you. Tickets must be purchased in advance - they will not be sold at the door Cost: Men $25 in advance; Women $25 in advance.

Eventbrite requires credit card payments. Sorry no exceptions or walk-ins.

Got Questions? You can post them below.
results.name: Cuddle Party™ For All Genders - Experiential Intimacy Workshop & Social Event

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 34-47 --1F/3M SPOTS LEFT

results.description:
10TH ANNUAL 50 FIRST JOKES NYC

n January 2nd! "50 Comics. One Mega Show. 1st New Joke of the New Year!" - That's been the logline that defines this very special party show, celebrating the massively talented stand up comedy scene in this City. A mixture of established NYC comedians along with the best and brightest up-and-comers share the stage to present the 1st new joke they've written since The Ball has dropped. This fun, fast and loose show is a favorite amongst audience and comedians 

alike. 


http://www.thebellhouseny.com/event/1027437-10th-annual-50-first-jokes-nyc-brooklyn/  for tickets

And 2016 marks a milestone for 50 First Jokes, because it's the 10 year anniversary of the show. 50FJ was started long ago in the backroom of a dive bar in Lower East Side. Now it's grown to be at sold-out event at The Bell House and has spawned annual sister shows in LA, Austin, New Orleans, Denver, Atlanta, Ann Arbor, and DC. 50FJ NYC is proudly produced by Sachi Ezura and John F. O'Donnell.HOSTED BY JOHN F. O'DONNELL

Links

According to the Comedy Central Insider Blog, "John F. O'Donnell is one of the more explosive comics in New York City. On stage, he's like a tightly capped liter of soda filled with lit fireworks." John has performed at a number of comedy festivals around the country and beyond, including The Bridgetown Comedy Festival, The Edinburgh Fringe Festival, The New York Comedy Festival, The San Francisco Comedy Festival, and The New Orleans Hell Yes Festival. He's been featured in the New York Times and the LA Times. He's been a favorite guest on the popular podcasts Keith and The Girl, You Made It Weird w/ Pete Holmes, You Had To Be There w/ Nikki & Sara, and Skeptic Tank w/ Ari Shaffir. He has almost 3 hours of stand up material available for digital download at livefromouterspace.com

results.description:
Q train to prospect park stop. its on the east side of the park.   I'm bringing someone who has experienced a lot of activity here.  it might be cold saturday so dress warm!!!


One of several small monuments in the vicinity of what is known as the “Battle Pass” in Prospect Park, the Dongan Oak Monument commemorates events which took place in this area during the Battle of Long Island on August 27, 1776. During this significant battle of the Revolutionary War, a large white oak mentioned in 1685 in the patent of Governor Thomas Dongan (1634–1715), was cut down by Colonial soldiers and thrown across the road to impede the advance of the British army.   there is a Dongan Oak Marker for Thomas Dongan.

results.description:
Happy New Year! 2016 brings peace, joy, better health and a deeper connection to self and tranquility... and a chance for new beginnings!


Welcome 2016, a New Year, with a deepened connection to self; a new inner grounding and peace of mind.  Setting an intention, fortifying it with Reiki and sending it into the universe with love and light for the upcoming year.  Surrounding yourself in positive energy to begin the New Year.  2016 a year of peace, health, acceptance, self-compassion, love and light.   Join us for an evening of Reiki, meditation and pranayama.and invite peace and happiness...


Doors open 5:45pm Reiki Circle begins at 6pm...


All are welcome to this healing circle of Reiki, meditation and pranayama (breathing).  New to Reiki, Pranayama or meditation?  Join us!  Interested in Reiki, Pranayama or meditation? Join us!  Already familiar with Reiki, Pranayama or meditation? Join us!  Reiki practitioner? Join us!  All are welcome! Come join this "New Year's Special" Reiki, Meditation and Pranayama (Yogic breathing) Healing Circle and get reconnected with self and happiness.  This hour long healing circle will help you center, balance and invite deep peace into your life, while giving you tools to use to practice at home and on your own, until we meet again.

The healing circle will begin with centering guided Pranayama (yogic breathing techniques that you will learn in the healing circle and can practice at home on your own until the next healing circle), followed by a brief Yoga centered guided meditation (centered around the Chakras, Dharma, Kharma, Ananda, transformation, finding balance, serenity, happiness, understanding your life's purpose and more) while you receive Reiki from an experienced Reiki Master, followed by more Reiki and Reiki sharing. This healing circle is for all who are interested in Reiki and meditation and is open to anyone who is interested in both giving and receiving Reiki.  All lineages are welcome.  There will be time for discussion and sharing.  No experience necessary.  Please dress comfortably and bring a yoga mat if you have one.  (Option to sit in a chair as well).  If you have a current yoga class package with Amanda you can use it towards this circle (just bring $5).  No yoga class package? No worries,  join us.  The entrance to the studio is on the side street facing Walgreens.  Questions?  Contact Amanda by email: [masked]  OR  text/ call (862) 621-9642....Namaste and we look forward to seeing you there :)

results.description:
Start off the New Year with healthy food and fellowship. Bring a raw vegan dish or slightly steamed vegetables. We will be doing music jamming if people are interested, hopefully after we eat our first helping, after 9 PM. Bring an instrument and some ideas. Wear your hippy clothes and play your drums and we can sing "You've Got to Change Your Evil Ways" because many will be starting changes and resolutions for the new year. 

We also need assistants who can be Co-Hosts when I am tied up with the music stuff. These responsibilities include welcoming guests, making sure there is always water, cups and dishes available, helping with cleaning and resetting up the dishes, answering the phones, helping people to find the restroom and coat closet and also helping people to put their dish on the table.
This is the time to really pitch in and make this group work. Lets make a commitment this New Year to do so. Snow date is the next Saturday 1/9/16 if we encounter bad weather. For more info you can contact me[masked] or by email to touch base about the music or co-hosting. Looking forward to seeing everybody again after many months of being tied up.

Please note that this is NOT A DATING GROUP FOR SINGLES but a social and support group for those living a raw (uncooked food) vegan lifestyle to some extent.
results.name: Raw Vegan Pot Luck

results.description:
The winter months are upon us and there's no better time to pack on the fat then now. We'll be scarfing down hamburgers on Friday and pizza on Saturday.  

While this event is geared towards singles in the 21 to 49 age range, anyone of any age is welcome to attend. 

When you come to a Date Walking event, you will take a casual stroll with anywhere from 5 to 15 wo/men over the course of around an hour. It's a really fun and relaxed way to meet someone special or multiple possibilities face-to-face. You can check out some photos from previous Date Walks here. 

We will meet at Buffalo Wild Wings at 7 PM and wait 20 minutes for everyone to arrive. Please note that we are only meeting at Buffalo Wild Wings. We will not be eating pizza there. 

We will be crawling to 2 pizza joints and they are very close so there will not be a lot of walking in sub-zero temps. The first place is Gloria Pizza and the second spot is A&J Pizza. I chose these establishments based on location, the speed of food delivery and the ability to accommodate a large group of ravenous pizza eaters. 

If you you do not want to eat pizza, that's ok. You can just come to meet people. By the way, if you can't or do not want to eat 2 slices, you can split slices with a buddy or just eat one. 

After our crawl we can get drinks somewhere. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 
  Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter
results.name: Forest Hills Singles Pizza Crawl

Hi Newark Social Family!!!

How are you feeling (great I hope, fingers crossed)?  I know all of us are busy and have a lot on our plates during the season to be giving.  However, I am taking a timeout to create a sound off board to wish all of you (as well as a chance to wish each other) a happy, healthy, and harmonious Christmas and New Years!!!  Share the joy and get your Care Bear Stare On!!!

results.description:
Are you craving deeper connections in your life?

Do you want to experience more awareness/presence in your day to day life ?

Do you ever have the feeling that you could be enjoying richer more authentic interactions with people?

Sometimes creating profound connection is as easy as looking just beneath the surface with whoever we are with, at any given time and simply being more present with what actually is.

Join The Connection Movement and Authentic Relating NYC at Reflections Yoga for social games that invite us beneath the surface and into a deeper experience of ourselves and others.

Authenticity Games are a fun, highly-interactive partner and group exercise that explore ways of seeing, connecting, appreciating yourself and others at a deeper level. They are a safe and structured way for us to go beyond small talk and beyond superficial appearances.

It’s an opportunity for us to have fun and celebrate with great people who are also wanting to explore what’s possible in connection.

Join us for some fun relational games, socializing, and snacks

Bring a friend, or come alone and meet some awesome new people.

When we celebrate and explore what makes each of us unique, we often end up realizing just how much we all have in common.

Games Night begins at 7 pm and will wrap up around 10 pm - we generally visit, eat, socialize, do acro-yoga, and hang out in cuddle-piles after the games wrap up. Hope you'll plan on lingering with us.

TO PAY IN ADVANCE: http://relatinggames.eventbrite.com/

Payment:
$30 at the door
$25 in advance

Reflections Yoga
227 East 24th Street
between 3rd and 2nd

(NOTE - the address for Reflections on Google Maps and Reflections' mobile site have not been updated to indicate the NEW location on East 24th Street)

Follow The Connection Movement on Facebook
www.facebook.com/theconnectmove

For updates on authentic relating events in New York, join our Meetup or Facebook groups

http://www.meetup.com/connectionmovement

https://www.facebook.com/groups/authenticrelatingnyc/
results.name: Connection Lab - Authenticity and Relating Games to Build Connection & Community

results.description:
Gaymes Night
Social evening of board games & cards. We provide the games (or bring your own to share), you provide the smarts!

Fun and non-competitive, open to all skill levels.
Held on the 1st, 3rd and 5th Saturdays of each month at 7 pm.

Snacks provided to feed the little grey cells.  Sometime the groups orders pizza.

$5.00 Donation requested, more if you can, less if you can't.

The LOFT uses multiple ways to promote the center's groups and events including meet-up.  The RSVP count on meet-up is not the only indication that people will be attending. Come check of The LOFT!

results.description:
You are invited to our next dinner at the Bell, Book and Candle Restaurant on Saturday, January 2nd.

Website
http://bbandcnyc.com/

Best known for an aeroponic roof garden that supplies most of its' produce, this cozy West Village restaurant is appreciated for its delicious seasonal American menu. Reasonable prices too!

Dinner is at 7pm, so please arrive a little earlier, to ensure we are seated at 7.

$5 deposit is required to be paid when you RSVP. Please send $5 to [masked] at Paypal.com within 24 hours of your RSVP to confirm your place.

How?

Go to www.paypal.com

At the top of the page, click send money. Put in the email address: [masked]

Amount: $5. That's it.

(You don't need a Paypal account to pay the deposit)
This deposit confirms your commitment to attend, and will be returned to you on arrival at the dinner.

A table for 8 has been reserved, so the first members to RSVP and pay the fee will reserve a space at the dinner.

You are responsible to pay for your food, drink and contribute to a tip, at the end of the meal. It is cash only. Please plan ahead and if possible calculate the cost of your meal, plus tip before the night.

Menu

Dinner

http://bbandcnyc.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2015/04/dinner041615.pdf

Drinks

http://bbandcnyc.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/wine011415.pdf

Desserts

http://bbandcnyc.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2014/12/dessert120114.pdf

Let's Talk
New.

Come along, enjoy great food, and make new friends.
Hope to see you then.
Shaz

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people signed up on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending.  if you want to know how many exactly or have any questions contact the event host [masked].

The New York Social Network has been bringing people together for fun events since 2004!   With so many different things to choose from it can be challenging to decide what to do especially if you are new to the group.  Our New and Existing Members Welcome Party is designed to bring together both new and long time members of the group in a casual and comfortable atmosphere. There is no overcrowding, no loud music and lot's of room to socialize.  Dave Cervini and members of our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.Here is what to expect:

-Doors open at 7:30pm.  Check in at the front and get your name tag and game pieces for the ice breakers games.  You can also pick up a schedule of upcoming event to look over so that you can ask questions about any that you are interested in.

-Drink specials till 8:30pm and complimentary appetizers

-Ice breaker games at 9pm

-Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone?  Yes, 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.

Dress code: Keep it clean and neat. Stay way from t shits and non dress jeans.

How long does it last?  Things usually quiet down by midnight

How do I get there? Lexington's is located on the ground floor of the Cort Hotel on the corner of Lexington and 39th.  Use the Lexington avenue entrance.  Grand Central is a few blocks away.

Cost $10 pay at door
results.name: New & Existing Members Welcome Party

results.description:
Single? New in town? Just looking to get out and meet new people?

Join us for our multi-group member happy hour! ATWYS along with New York Social Network organizes a monthly Saturday night get together for all of our new and existing members.

If you are new to our Meteup group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. Event Host, New York Social Network  founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.


$10 in advance only

Prepay here:
 http://atwys2013member.eventbrite.com/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect. 

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.
results.name: Multi-Group Private Member Social Happy Hour - Over 70 prepaid

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 28-40 -1F/3M SPOT LEFT

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 28-40 --SOLD OUT FOR MEN

group.name: And That's Why You're Single Events - NYC - Singles 25-55

results.description:
Maia McCormick will call a lively program of contras to the (as yet) unnamed band of Jonah Sidman, Michael Friedman, and Jody Kruskal! This fiddle, piano, concertina trio will be sure to rock the house!

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

Contra dance is a high energy American folk dance accompanied by live string music and taught by a caller.  No partner or experience required.  All dances are taught in advance and the figures are easy to learn.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.
results.name: Contra Dance with Maia McCormick and JMJ!

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people signed up on your Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending.  if you want to know how many exactly or have any questions contact the event host [masked].

The New York Social Network has been bringing people together for fun events since 2004!   With so many different things to choose from it can be challenging to decide what to do especially if you are new to the group.  Our New and Existing Members Welcome Party is designed to bring together both new and long time members of the group in a casual and comfortable atmosphere. There is no overcrowding, no loud music and lot's of room to socialize.  Dave Cervini and members of our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.Here is what to expect:

-Doors open at 7:30pm.  Check in at the front and get your name tag and game pieces for the ice breakers games.  You can also pick up a schedule of upcoming event to look over so that you can ask questions about any that you are interested in.

-Drink specials till 8:30pm and complimentary appetizers

-Ice breaker games at 9pm

-Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone?  Yes, 98% of those attending will likely come on their own.

Dress code: Keep it clean and neat. Stay way from t shits and non dress jeans.

How long does it last?  Things usually quiet down by midnight

How do I get there? Lexington's is located on the ground floor of the Cort Hotel on the corner of Lexington and 39th.  Use the Lexington avenue entrance.  Grand Central is a few blocks away.

Cost $10 pay at door
results.name: New & Existing Members Welcome Party

results.description:
The concert features, Frank Vignola and his bandmates Lou Pallo on rhythm guitar and bassist Nicki Parrott. 

Each Monday for more than a decade, three musicians made magic on Broadway creating the sound behind legendary guitar wizard Les Paul at the Iridium Jazz Club. Sanctuary friend Frank Vignola was a member of that trio.

Tickets are $25 (general seating).

The link for complete details, including ticket purchases, is: http://www.sanctuaryconcerts.org/

IF YOU HAVE RSVP'd, BE SURE TO ORDER YOUR TICKETS AS SOON AS POSSIBLE. 

AS IT GETS CLOSER TO FRIDAY OR SATURDAY OF THIS WEEK, I WILL PROVIDE A MEETING POINT AT THE CHURCH.

PLEASE EDIT YOUR MEETUP ACCOUNT SETTINGS TO ALLOW FOR MESSAGES TO BE SENT TO YOU.
results.name: REMINDER; Frank and Friends: Reuniting the Les Paul Trio

Keep that holiday feeling going with a super night of dancing at Gotham Swing Club's monthly dance. I will be this month's guest teacher so join me for the a beginner and a intermediate lesson.

Post-Lesson, Gotham's own Marlon Mills will be our guest DJ for a great night of dancing.

With paid admission you get:
8:00- 8:30 Beginner lesson for those starting out or who want to work on basics.
8:30-9:00, Int/Adv Lesson with Sophie -or- Guided beginner practice with a Gotham staff member

9:00-12:30 Marlon takes over the turntables for a super night of dancing to get the new year started on the right foot..

$10 – members

$15 – non-members

Please feel free to invite your friends.

results.description:
Single? New in town? Just looking to get out and meet new people?

Join us for our multi-group member happy hour! ATWYS along with New York Social Network organizes a monthly Saturday night get together for all of our new and existing members.

If you are new to our Meteup group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. Event Host, New York Social Network  founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Dec 12 Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$10 in advance only

Prepay here: http://atwys2013member.eventbrite.com/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect. 

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.
results.name: Private Member Happy Hour - Ages 21-50

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.

results.description:
Is one of your new year's resolutions to meet new people? Then you should join us for this private multi-group social for all new and existing members.

Forget about overcrowded bars, long lines to get in and people with attitudes. This will be one of the most friendliest and social Meetups you'll experience!

We will have our staff there to welcome all members and help introduce you to each other. It's fun and laid back event that creates the perfect opportunity to make new friends.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (TICKETS WILL NOT BE SOLD AT DOOR) -

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Jan-02-2016_at_0800PM

What to expect:

• Complimentary Hot & Cold Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink Specials (8-9pm)

• Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling

• Socialize, Network & Connect With Other Members

PREPAY ONLY ($10) Price goes to $20 as event gets closer: 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Jan-02-2016_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

How many people attend? This is a multi-Meetup group event and we'll have 100+ members attending. 

Is this age/ethnic specific? No. We'll have a wide range of ages attending. All are welcome 21+. 

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Jan-02-2016_at_0800PM

results.description:
Is one of your new year's resolutions to meet new people? Then you should join us for this private multi-group social for all new and existing members.

Forget about overcrowded bars, long lines to get in and people with attitudes. This will be one of the most friendliest and social Meetups you'll experience!

We will have our staff there to welcome all members and help introduce you to each other. It's fun and laid back event that creates the perfect opportunity to make new friends.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (TICKETS WILL NOT BE SOLD AT DOOR) -

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Jan-02-2016_at_0800PM

What to expect:

• Complimentary Hot & Cold Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink Specials (8-9pm)

• Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling

• Socialize, Network & Connect With Other Members

PREPAY ONLY ($10) Price goes to $20 as event gets closer: 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Jan-02-2016_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own. 

How many people attend? This is a multi-Meetup group event and we'll have 100+ members attending. 

Is this age/ethnic specific? No. We'll have a wide range of ages attending. All are welcome 21+. 

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Jan-02-2016_at_0800PM

<a href="https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Jan-02-2016_at_0800PM"></a>

results.name: Salsondria & La Temática at Subrosa Saturday, 1/2 @ 8PM!

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 6 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - Trying something new.


Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.

results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:  www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time. I would like to stagger players. You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left. Thank you for your understanding.

Saturdays, starts 8pm

Cost $40

Includes tennis, balls and food

9 Indoor air-conditioned hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

(201)[masked] Cell

results.description:
Your Holidays were a bust! Your broke from Christmas, hungover from New Years, and you already broke your resolutions! Why sit around and feel down, when you can come share some laughs for FREE!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room. Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Seating in the backroom starts at 9 and the show starts shortly after.
Come early and hang out in the front room of the bar!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. Come out and celebrate the weekends with some laughs!
results.name: Let Me Speak To Your Manager- Free Comedy Show w. Pre-show Hangout

DESI SATURDAYS 

Presents 

BOLLYWOOD BEATS

L E X I C O N 
226 East 54th Street. NYC 

Special Guest : Featuring Delhi's Finest DJ AMIT 
Lexicon Resident : DJ HARSH 
Dhol Percussions By : RAVI BINDRA 

SPONSORED VIP OPEN BAR 9:30-10:30PM 
LADIES COMPLIMENTARY ADMISSION TIL 10:30PM 

Dress Code: Fashion Forward & Chic 
Strictly No T-shirts, No Boots, No sneakers.

For Large Groups :[masked]

Desi Saturdays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty. 

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Saturday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Saturdays Nights at Lexicon!!

results.description:
BACHATA Night!

DJs: Brian "EL MATATAN", Young Maestra and Milton "EL TOLETE"

@ 10pm Milton "EL TOLETE" teaching the basics and Logistics of BACHATA.

What to wear: Dancing is about movement and enjoyment. We recommend wearing comfortable clothing that allows you to be flexible and relaxed. In order to be able to move comfortably across the floor, we advise that you do not wear rubber-soled shoes.

Do I need a partner ?: No, you don’t need to bring a partner. We rotate during the group class, It will give you the opportunity to dance and meet different people.

Have a Birthday Coming up! Contact us to do your Bday Party.


More information: 

https://www.facebook.com/events/663744417058409/

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
